PARAGRAPH.STRING: or Temüjin by birthname, (c. 1162-August 18, 1227) (IPA: IPA: ʧiŋgɪs χaːŋ, Mongolian: [Mongolian: Чингис Хаан], [Chinese: 成吉思汗] Chéngjísī Hán, Turkic: Chengez Khan, Chinggis Khan, Chinggis Xaan, Chingis Khan, Jenghis Khan, Chinggis Qan, Cengiz Han etc.), was a Mongol political and military leader or Khan (posthumously Khagan)

founded the Mongol Empire (Yeke Mongol Ulus, Екэ Монгол Улус), (1206-1368), the largest contiguous empire in world history. Born to the name Temüjin in the Borjigin family (Mongolian: [Mongolian: Тэмүүжин], ),
forged a powerful army based on meritocracy to become one of the most successful military leaders in the whole of history.
image in most of the world is that of a ruthless, bloodthirsty conqueror,
is an iconic and beloved figure in Mongolia, where
is seen as the father of the Mongol Nation (see also Mongolia). Before becoming a Khan,
eliminated and united many of the nomadic tribes of north East Asia and Central Asia under a social identity as the "Mongols."

Starting with the invasion of Western Xia and Jin Dynasty in northern China and consolidating through numerous conquests including the Khwarezmid Empire in Persia, Mongol rule across the Eurasian landmass radically altered the demography and geopolitics of these areas. The Mongol Empire ended up ruling, or at least briefly conquering, large parts of modern day China, Mongolia, Russia, Azerbaijan, Armenia, Georgia, Iraq, Iran, Turkey, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, Pakistan, Tajikistan, Afghanistan, Turkmenistan, Moldova, and Kuwait.
